author: Special Correspondent
text:
Kaadayampatti became the 13th taluk in Salem district.

The new taluk carved out from the existing Omalur taluk, was inaugurated by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa through video conference on Saturday.

Tribal villages

More than 20,000 people residing in about 10 tribal villages including Kannappadi, Kanavaipudur, Veerachiyur, and Danishpettai had to visit Omalur, situated about 35-50 km away for getting all the government certificates and benefits.

They have been demanding the creation of a new taluk with Kaadayampatti as headquarters for many decades.

The Chief Minister announced the creation of the new taluk office with Kadayampatti as headquarters under Rule 110 in the State Assembly in August 2015.

J. Megnath Reddy, Sub-Collector, Mettur, Palpalli C. Krishnan, MLA, and others were present at the Kaadayampatti taluk office on the occasion.

The Salem West and Salem South taluk offices, both in the city, have got new premises.

The new premises were declared open by Chief Minister Jayalalithaa through video conference on Saturday.

The Salem West taluk office building has come up at an outlay of Rs. 2.02 crore at Jagir Ammapalayam.

The Salem South taluk office building has been constructed at an equal cost at Maniyanur.

V. Sampath, District Collector, and V. Panneerselvam, MP, were present at Salem West taluk office, while Mayor S. Soundappan, was present at Salem South taluk office when the Chief Minister declared open the new premises.
title: New taluk inaugurated
